thread.title: If You Own A Samsung TV, The CIA Might Be Spying On You Right Now
thread.title_full: If You Own A Samsung TV, The CIA Might Be Spying On You Right Now

author: Paul Watson
title: If You Own A Samsung TV, The CIA Might Be Spying On You Right Now

organizations.name: wikileaks alleged cia dump claims cia

text:
Wikileaks Alleged CIA Dump Claims CIA And MI5 Hacked Samsung Smart TVs © Getty Images Wikileaks Alleged CIA Dump Claims CIA And MI5 Hacked Samsung Smart TVs Trending News: If You Own A Samsung TV, The CIA Might Be Spying On You Right Now Shares Long Story Short 
Wikileaks dumped the mother load of over 8,000 documents it claims contains "the entire hacking capacity of the CIA," including claims that the U.S. teamed up with British intelligence to infect certain Samsung smart TVs with malware. Long Story 
Wikileaks has delivered the long-awaited "Year Zero" or "Vault 7" document leak and it’s potentially a big one for explosive revelations. RELEASE: Vault 7 Part 1 "Year Zero": Inside the CIA's global hacking force https://t.co/h5wzfrReyy pic.twitter.com/N2lxyHH9jp 
Amongst the 8,761 documents is the revelation that the U.S. Consulate in Frankfurt is a covert CIA hacker base covering Europe, the Middle East and Africa under the name Center for Cyber Intelligence Europe. U.S. Consulate in Frankfurt is a covert CIA hacker base https://t.co/K7wFTdlC82 pic.twitter.com/oqjtcVb56E — WikiLeaks (@wikileaks) March 7, 2017 
The hackers in Frankfurt allegedly receive diplomatic passports and among the documents are guides that tell hackers everything they need to know, from their excuse that they are "supporting technical consultations at the Consulate" to the best way to travel to Frankfurt. CIA tips for its hackers going to the covert CIA hacking base hidden in the US consulate in Frankfurt #Vault7 https://t.co/OoGhXa0rAJ pic.twitter.com/iyuZhVEXms — WikiLeaks (@wikileaks) March 7, 2017 
One of the more humorous highlights is a document that advises that "booze is free on Lufthansa (German national airline), so enjoy (within reason)!" and states ‘"Flying United: My condolences, but at least you are earning a United leg towards a status increase." Wikileaks 
The less funny claims include allegations that the CIA and Britain’s MI5 worked together to put malware on Samsung smart TVs that allowed them to be used as microphones even when they appeared to be switched off in a project named ‘Weeping Angel." Jointly developed CIA+MI5 malware infests Samsung smart TVs to turn them into covert microphones #Vault7 pic.twitter.com/Ki0wRlgjPP
